abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Transport and
            Infrastructure Development Project for Sudan were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was substantial; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory; and grantee performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            flow of funds from the government for road maintenance had
            to compete with emergency and security road construction and
            other government priorities. Road maintenance had always
            been minimal compared to the need. The project has greatly
            contributed to addressing the principal challenge of
            capacity limitation to deliver results in the post conflict
            and newly emerging country. Further, training of staff only
            by itself is not adequate in building institutional capacity
            and it appears that direct engagement of staff during
            procurement and contract management processes in the form of
            on the job training is essential. The capacity of the
            construction industry in South Sudan was very low during
            project preparation and implementation. All contracted firms
            were foreign and often hired workers from outside the
            country. Lessons emerging from other places suggest
            including some maintenance funding in the project to ensure
            sustainability in medium term. The project experienced
            massive claims under component two due to delays affected by
            externalities indifferent to project activities, weak
            reporting structures, and inexperience of the implementing
            agencies. In order to avoid underrating the outcome of the
            project, the formulation of the results framework should
            have attempted to include specific objectives for each phase
            rather than establish a general Project Development
            Objective (PDO) for the whole project.
